src:
Partizan raspucan u Rakovici, igrao i sin Gorana Troboka
Šansu dobili Pešukić, Dinga, Vulićević, Gigić...

06 Nov 2019


Prvi tim u Mančesteru, rezervisti i fudbaleri skromne minutaže tokom jesenje sezone u Rakovici. Partizan je dao šansu igračima koji trenutno nisu u prvom planu kod Sava Miloševića da ostanu u ritmu, tako što je gostovao na terenu Druge beogradske lige i rutinski slavio – 8:0.

Crno-bele je s klupe predvodio Albert Nađ, od nedavno šef stručnog štaba Teleoptika, i dalje aktivno uključen u rad prvog tima. Njegov zadatak je, između ostalog, da bude spona sa seniorskim sastavom i vodi računa o razvoju talenata iz omladinske škole, kao i pripremi fudbalera koji ne igraju takmičarske utakmice, kako bi bili spremni kad i ako dobiju šansu kod Miloševića.
Tako su danas, primera radi, na terenu bili letošnji potpisnici, Dominik Dinga, Periša Pešukić i Petar Gigić, izdanci mlađih kategorija Nikola Lakčević, Slobodan Stanojlović, Zlatan Šehović, iskusni Miroslav Vulićević, kome je ostalo dva meseca do kraja ugovora... Posebno je zanimljivo što je priliku dobio Damjan Trobok, 19-godišnji talenat, inače sin nekadašnjeg prvotimca Parnog valjka, Gorana Torboka.
Partizan je u prvom poluvremenu igrao u sledećem sastavu: Slavković, Pešukić, Smiljković, Dinga, Šehović, Smiljanić, Marinković, Stanojlović, Lakčević, S. Jovanović, Gigić. U nastavku su na terenu bili: Damjanović – Vulićević, Smiljković, Petrović, Trobok, Smiljanić, Marinković, Stanić, Lakčević, Marković, Čapljić.


Pogledajte novu epizodu serije Ekipizza...





FOTO: Star sport
text:
Partisan cracked in Rakovica, played by Goran Troboka's son
The chance was given to Pešukić, Dinga, Vulićević, Gigić ...

06 Nov 2019


First team in Manchester, reservists and footballers of modest minutes during the fall season in Rakovica. Partizan gave players who are not currently in the forefront with Savo Milosevic a chance to stay in rhythm by visiting the Second Belgrade League and routinely celebrating - 8-0.

The Black and White team was led by Albert Nagy, most recently the Teleoptics Chief of Staff, and still actively involved in the work of the first team. His job, among other things, is to liaise with the senior squad and take care of developing talent from the youth school, as well as preparing football players who do not play competitive matches, so that they will be ready when and if they get a chance with Milosevic.
So today, for example, on the field were this year's signatories, Dominik Dinga, Perisa Pesukić and Petar Gigic, shoots of the younger categories Nikola Lakcevic, Slobodan Stanojlovic, Zlatan Sehovic, experienced Miroslav Vulicevic, who has two months left until the end of the contract ... It is interesting that the opportunity was given to Damjan Trobok, a 19-year-old talent, who is the son of former Steam Roller champion Goran Torbok.
Partizan played in the first half in the following squad: Slavkovic, Peskovic, Smiljkovic, Dinga, Sehovic, Smiljanic, Marinkovic, Stanojlovic, Lakcevic, S. Jovanovic, Gigic. The following were on the field: Damjanovic-Vulicevic, Smiljkovic, Petrovic, Trobok, Smiljanic, Marinkovic, Stanic, Lakcevic, Markovic, Capljic.


Check out the new episode of the Ekipizza series ...





PHOTO: Star Sports
